headline: Apple's AI could be revived by this acquisition, Dan Ives says
summary: Apple (AAPL) is expected to unveil a new iPhone model at its upcoming event. Wedbush Securities managing director and global head of technology research Dan Ives talks about how Apple is struggling to find its footing in the artificial intelligence (AI) race. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Samsung, SK Hynix Sag After US Revokes China Chip Permits
summary: While both Korean companies have memory plants in Korea, China accounts for a major slice of their global output.  Samsung sank more than 2%, while SK Hynix stock was more than 4% lower in morning trading.

raw.headline: Samsung, SK Hynix Sag After US Revokes China Chip Permits

headline: Apple Hebbal opens this Tuesday, September 2, in Bengaluru
summary: BENGALURU, India, September 01, 2025--Apple® today previewed its newest store in India, Apple Hebbal, located in the technology capital of Bengaluru. The store will be Apple’s first in South India and third in the country, joining Apple BKC in Mumbai and Apple Saket in Delhi and the Apple Store online. Apple Hebbal will be a welcoming space for customers to shop Apple’s full lineup of products, experience the best service and support, and participate in free Today at Apple sessions to discover a

headline: This Giant German Tech Stock Can Run With the Mag 7. The Case to Buy in.
summary: The U.S. has the Magnificent Seven, but Europe has “der Eine,” or the One—German software provider  SAP  After an earnings-related pullback, the stock now looks like it’s worth buying.  In fact, SAP is the only stock that deserves mention with the great U.S. tech companies, whether Microsoft and the rest of the  or smaller ones like Oracle and Salesforce.  Although nothing was obviously wrong with them, the results still triggered a 10% pullback since then as investors fretted about the impact of a weakening dollar and a miss on cloud revenue growth.

In fact, SAP is the only stock that deserves mention with the great U.S. tech companies, whether Microsoft and the rest of the  or smaller ones like Oracle and Salesforce.  Although nothing was obviously wrong with them, the results still triggered a 10% pullback since then as investors fretted about the impact of a weakening dollar and a miss on cloud revenue growth.
